Params: {1: 'Kowloong', 2: 'November 10, 05:27', 4: 'All sectors of the Tabula Akasha data layer have terminated their self-check.', 5: '1200m under Kowloong, Physical Layer of Tabula Akasha'}
{3: 'The flames of war burning out the Chamber of Commerce and Kowloong are on the verge of engulfing the entire Tabula Akasha.'}
{3: 'The intense pain from her Deep M.I.N.D. almost renders her speechless.'}
{3: 'Normally, consciousness data extracted and uploaded to the Tabula Akasha can never be reloaded back.'}

{3: 'Writing consciousness requires extremely precise operations and stringent conditions. To prevent any potential misuse of the Tabula Akasha and Huaxu for altering consciousness, all uploaded consciousness is considered dead by common standards.'}
{3: 'This is why there are no living people in the Tabula Akasha.'}
{3: 'Because the fear of death is deeply ingrained in humans, a fundamental instinct.'}
{3: 'Therefore, even if consciousness returns to reality, it will be constantly haunted by the conflicting impulses to live and to die.'}
{3: 'Death is final, and the dead can never truly be resurrected.'}
{3: "And those who linger between life and death will never find solace in death's embrace."}
{3: 'The echoes of war are the only sounds that answer her on the empty streets.'}
{3: 'She can no longer recall how many years have passed within the data realms of the Tabula Akasha.'}
{3: 'All she remembers is continents drifting and merging, oceans evaporating and refilling, and planets dying and being reborn.'}
{1: '"The final divergence point of the ideal confidence simulation... is your death."', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '2', 10: '1'}

{1: '"This unit cannot confirm the accuracy of this simulation, but it is the only approximate solution derived under the influence of uncontrollable variables."', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 9: '1', 10: '1'}
{3: 'She herself is the sacrifice Kowloong must make for a glimpse of its future.'}
{3: 'Thus, with each cycle she endures within the Tabula Akasha, she suffers—'}
{3: "In every possible future, the fire that consumed the entire world ultimately extinguishes Kowloong's flame, leaving no exceptions."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Even if she orchestrated a logically justified death for herself, Kowloong remains unsaved.'}
{3: 'Upon that fragile thread tied to Kowloong lies destiny.'}
{3: 'Rising from the mountain of corpses and the sea of blood is the last survivor, the final reign<//SINNER>.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Qu?', 3: 'Beneath my throne lies the graveyard of history.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Qu?', 3: 'A palace built of bones and lies, is my only dwelling in the empty stars.', 4: '1'}
{3: '<The beast devours, flames consume, and a boiling river of blood churns everything in its path.>'}
{3: '<The crimson sky, neither day nor night, makes it impossible to discern where the sun sets. Cries for help echo from all directions, only to dissipate futilely in this forest of death.>'}
{3: 'The Punishing Virus and Hetero-Creatures are devouring both the flesh of reality and virtual data, while flames that lick the sky chew on the spine of the Tabula Akasha.'}
{3: '<Later, when I stand on the mountain of corpses and the sea of blood, those soldiers are gone.>'}
{3: '<They might be part of that sea now, claimed by the war itself.>'}
{3: "<I know, it's part of war, a price that must be paid. I shouldn't be so sentimental.>"}
{3: '<It makes my hands search the ground, filling my nails with blood and dirt.>'}
{3: '<It compels me to search and dig, despite the futility.>'}
{3: '<All that remains are bodies melded with metal.>'}
{3: 'Billions of years and trillions of cycles weigh heavily on me.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'But I continue my relentless search among the ruins.'}
{3: 'Among the crumbled walls and the blackened hills.'}
{1: '"In the end, I am unable to leave a brighter future for Kowloong and this world."'}
{3: '"In the end, I am unable to leave a brighter future for Kowloong and this world."'}
{3: 'I see those threads snapping one by one around me.'}
{1: '"Your judgment is spot on, as usual, Miss Qu."'}
{3: '"Your judgment is spot on, as usual, Miss Qu."'}
{1: '"Since there\'s a \'cost,\' then surely, \'compensation\' is due."'}
{3: '"Since there\'s a \'cost,\' then surely, \'compensation\' is due."'}
{1: 'This is what war leaves in its wake.'}
{3: 'This is what war leaves in its wake.'}
{3: 'Yet here I am, still searching through the ruins.'}
{3: 'In the crimson mire, in an era of ruins—'}
{3: 'Until I lift another broken slab and find a strand of blue hair beneath.'}
{3: 'Until my blood stains the soil of Kowloong.'}
{3: 'Her body is wrapped in bandages, fresh wounds layered over old scars.'}
{3: 'Despite the vital fluid seeping from my hands, despite the molten agony swirling in my mind.'}
{3: 'My hands slap her face and press on her chest.'}
{3: 'When the girl finally opens her eyes, she slowly relaxes her clenched fist.'}
{3: 'Cradled in her palm is a gleaming medal.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chi Ling', 3: 'I, officer of the Pulao Crew, will hereby be your second in command.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chi Ling', 3: "Lady Qu, what brings you here? These recruits still haven't been approved for review yet.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chi Ling', 3: 'Let the rookies complain. This training will improve their chances of survival on the battlefield.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chi Ling', 3: "I'm too serious? Sorry, I don't know how to act at a celebration banquet.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chi Ling', 3: 'I, Chi Ling... have completed my mission...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Over the past billions of years, stars have perished, and the universe has aged.'}
{3: "Throughout the brief yet extensive history documented by humanity, the oppressive, dark, and hopeless periods that I've encountered have left a vivid mark across the ages."}
{3: 'I cannot allow myself to step into such an era.'}
{3: 'I cannot allow my people to step into such an era.'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'And I shall make all things right.', 4: '1'}
